channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland

item.title: PSNI review recommends Crossmaglen station closure
item.description: A review into policing in south Armagh identifies "significant trust and confidence issues".

item.title: NI hospitals: 400 emergency patients wait over 12 hours for bed
item.description: A senior doctor says many of those waiting for beds are "our most vulnerable patients".

item.title: Aidan O'Brien: Inquiry into urology consultant to begin next week
item.description: More than a thousand patients' records were recalled due to concerns about the work of Aidan O'Brien.

item.title: Australian firm to create 120 jobs in NI over five years
item.description: Economy Minister Gordon Lyons says the jobs would generate over Â£3m in annual salaries.

item.title: Covid-19: Economy minister calls for plans to end restrictions
item.description: Economy Minister Gordon Lyons says the NI Executive needs to "start moving on these issues".

item.title: Troubles pensions scheme opens for applications
item.description: It offers payments to people injured during the Troubles but is more than a year behind schedule.

item.title: Thousands of pupils return to NI schools
item.description: The new academic year begins, with 350,000 children and young people going back to classrooms.

item.title: Kircubbin: Child dies after being hit by car
item.description: The young boy died in hospital after the incident on the Rowreagh Road near Kircubbin.

item.title: Brexit: What next for the Northern Ireland Protocol?
item.description: Decisions will have to be made, with some significant grace periods due to expire soon.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Bethany Firth takes silver in S14 200m individual medley
item.description: Bethany Firth claims her third medal at the Tokyo Paralympics with silver in the S14 200m individual medley

item.title: Universal Credit reduction will cause families to struggle
item.description: Plans to end a pandemic top-up to the benefit may affect more than 100,000 households in NI.

item.title: Covid-19: Six more Covid-linked deaths and 1,259 new cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,358.

item.title: New destinations added to Northern Ireland travel green list
item.description: Seven more locations including Canada, Denmark and Switzerland are now on the green list.

item.title: Covid-19: Surge in children's issues forecast post-pandemic
item.description: There could be a "generation of invisible children" who missed out on healthcare, says a QUB report.

item.title: Covid-19: Another 43 virus-related deaths recorded by Nisra
item.description: The agency's total number of Covid-19 related deaths in Northern Ireland now stands at 3,129.

item.title: Covid-19: NI pupils in contact with coronavirus case can stay in class
item.description: Staff who are fully vaccinated will also not have to self isolate if they are a close contact.

item.title: Covid-19: Pandemic had severe impact on young people, says report
item.description: Insufficient consideration was given to the effect on children and young people, says a report.

item.title: High Street voucher scheme to launch after 12 September
item.description: Every adult in Northern Ireland will be eligible for a Â£100 pre-paid card.

item.title: Afghanistan: Interpreter's family granted refugee status in Ireland
item.description: Bilal, who worked with British troops in Helmand in 2012, says his emotions are "out of this world".

item.title: The Troubles: When Belfast children fled the city
item.description: In the early years of the Troubles, thousands of people in Northern Ireland fled their homes.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Belfast football tournament integrating ethnic communities
item.description: Teams representing 15 nations have been taking part in the second Northern Ireland Confederation Cup.

item.title: Irish Navy at 75: 'My wife at home has it much harder'
item.description: BBC News NI talks to Irish Navy personnel as the service marks its 75th anniversary.

item.title: Talking points ahead of new Irish Premiership season
item.description: As the Irish Premiership campaign of 2020-21 prepares to kick off this weekend, we examine some of the big points of discussion ahead of the new season.

item.title: Bracken bashing in the Castlerock countryside
item.description: Environmentalists are trying to help native species and wildlife to thrive in the coastal area

item.title: 'We were hurt in bombs through no fault of our own'
item.description: Jennifer McNern lost both her legs and Margaret Yeaman was blinded in separate IRA bomb attacks.

item.title: The fishing group supporting men with their mental health
item.description: Thomas Campbell, who suffered with addiction, set up the fishing group as a safe space for men.

item.title: Brexit: Irish government harming NI ties with UK, says Donaldson
item.description: The DUP leader says relations between Dublin and Belfast could become untenable over the NI Protocol.

item.title: United Rugby Championship: Fly through the home of Ulster Rugby with BBC Sport NI
item.description: Take a flight through the home of Ulster Rugby with BBC Sport NI as we prepare to bring you live United Rugby Championship matches this season across TV, online and radio.

item.title: Paralympics: Tokyo gold 'sweetest of all' for sprinter Smyth
item.description: Jason Smyth says he crossed the line unsure if he had added to his record breaking gold medal haul.

item.title: Strabane: Man left 'badly shaken' after bat attack
item.description: Three men arrested following the incident on Monday are assisting police with their inquiries.

item.title: Derry: Man released over masked men mural gunfire
item.description: The 30-year-old man was arrested under the Terrorism Act in Londonderry on Saturday evening.

item.title: Sinn FÃ©in needed shake up in Foyle, says McDonald
item.description: The party leader visits the Foyle constituency as nominations open to replace the party's MLAs there.

item.title: Republic of Ireland: FAI announces equal pay for men's and women's senior teams
item.description: The Republic of Ireland men's and women's teams will receive the same match fees on international duty with immediate effect, the FAI says.

item.title: County Meath: Murder investigation after man's body found
item.description: The 19-year-old's body was found with a single gunshot wound in County Meath.

item.title: Ireland and France links never been stronger, says Martin after Macron visit
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron meets the Irish president and the taoiseach on a visit to Dublin.

item.title: Afghanistan: Irish emergency mission helps 36 people out of country
item.description: The Irish government says it will continue its effort to help Irish citizens in crisis-hit Kabul.

item.title: Beacon Hospital: School 'did not solicit' Covid vaccines
item.description: The Beacon Hospital in Dublin had administered 20 Covid-19 vaccines to teachers at a private school.
